original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares jump on President’s remarks on IMF
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares jumped in mid day trade on Tuesday, after President Ranil Wickremesinghe addressed the Parliament as the Letter of Intent has been signed covering the deal with the International Monetary Fund to be submitted to its Executive Board for approval, an analyst said.
During the President’s address in the Parliament he said, Sri Lanka got a second letter from China yesterday and the same night the letter of intent was signed and sent to the IMF for approval.
“We expect Board Approval in the third or fourth week of March,” President Wickremesinghe said.
All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 2.05 percent or 193.50 points to 9,638.82, while the most liquid index was up 1.51 percent or 42.97 points to 2,881.51 at 1200 hours.
“News on the IMF coming to its conclusion has pushed up banking counters massively which is pulling the market up, because that is the biggest share counter in the stock market,” an analyst said.
Investors expect a fall in market rates once the IMF has agreed to provide its loan to Sri Lanka, an analyst said.
Top gainers during 1200 hours was Sampath Bank, NDB and HNB. (Colombo/Mar07/2023)
